edu.pitt.dbmi.facebase.hd
Class TrueCryptManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.pitt.dbmi.facebase.hd.TrueCryptManager

public class TrueCryptManager
extends java.lang.Object

Performs TrueCrypt and file and shell operations. Calls ShellExecutor.launchProcess alot Touches, creates, mounts, dismounts and copies-to-final-location TrueCrypt volume. Has a pair of methods for each call to the shell--one to build command-line strings, and the other passes that String to the Shell for execution. See /usr/bin/truecrypt -h for truecrypt operation.

Constructor Detail

TrueCryptManager

public TrueCryptManager(java.lang.String keyval,
                        long sizeInBytes,
                        java.lang.String volumeLocation,
                        java.lang.String volumeMountLocation,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> trueCryptParams)
Construct with all the details needed to manipulate truecrypt

Parameters:
keyval - the encryption key.
sizeInBytes - how much data will need to be copied to the volume.
volumeLocation - filesystem path where TrueCrypt file processing occurs.
volumeMountLocation - non-full-path directory under which truecrypt volume will be mounted.
trueCryptParams - truecrypt options for creating, mounting, dismounting truecrypt file--set in and gathered from hd.properties file

touchVolume

public boolean touchVolume()
"/bin/touch" TrueCrypt volume file using not the shell but FileUtils.touch() Creates zero-length file truecrypt binary requires that the file holding the truecrypt volume exists before it will create a truecrypt volume

Returns:
true if successful creating the file housing the truecrypt volume.
